isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - HOOD, GRILLE AND FENDERS - IC BUS - ADJUSTMENTS - HOOD

svcprocinfo.para: Improper positioning of the hood relative to the cab can cause the tilt mechanism to malfunction and can interfere with engine components.
The front of the hood is to be at the proper height, which will allow a parallel gap between the bottom front edge of the hood and the bumper.
The hood is to be centered so the clearances for the radiator and air intake box-to-splash panels and shock absorbers are adequate.
Before adjusting the hood, be sure the chassis is on a level surface and the hood is mounted properly to the cab. Adjust the radiator-to-cowl dimension for IC BUS, as follows.

Perform the following procedure for a new hood installation, or for a hood that has been removed and re-installed, to assure that the hood is positioned correctly relative to the cab, front bumper and radiator.

svcsubproc.para: To adjust the right and left side hood hinges (Item 1) up or down (Item 2) to meet the hood-to-cowl 1/2 inch spacing specification, use the following procedure.

step1.para: Make 2 wood spacer blocks that are sized 1/2 x 1.0 x 24.0 inches (12.7 x 25.4 x 609.6 mm).

With the hood closed and latched, try to place the 2 hood-to-cowl spacer blocks on top of the cowl flange between the hood and cowl. If the hood needs adjustment to allow the spacer blocks to fit between the hood and cowl or to make the hood rest against the front of the spacer blocks, adjust as follows.
Release the hood latches on each side of the hood and tilt the hood assembly to full open position.
Position the 2 hood-to-cowl spacer blocks on the cowl flange.
Loosen (to finger tight), but do not remove, the 2 lower hinge plate bracket hex bolts (Item 3) and push the hood down (Item 2) at both lower hinge plate brackets (Item 4), driver side shown.

Carefully close the hood so the rear edge of the hood rests against the front of the hood-to-cowl spacer blocks. Make sure the spacer blocks are equally spaced and are sitting on the cowl flange, then latch the hood on both sides.

If the hood cannot be closed with the rear edge of the hood resting against the front of the hood-to-cowl spacer blocks and latched, it may be necessary to push the hood forward at both lower hinge plates (Item 5). Refer to IC BUS Hood Adjustment Forward or Back at the Lower Hinge Plate.

With the hood resting against the hood-to-cowl spacer blocks and the hood latched on both sides, make sure the bottom front edge of the hood is parallel with the line of the bumper. Then tighten the 2 lower hinge plate hex bolts (Item 3) at each lower hinge plate bracket (Item 4), driver side shown. Tighten to 75 to 85 ft-lbs. (102 to 115 Nm).
Release the hood latches on each side of the hood,tilt the hood assembly, and remove the hood-to-cowl spacer blocks from the cowl flange.
Close and latch the hood on both sides.

svcsubproc.title: Hood Adjustment Side-to-Side at the Upper Hinge Plate
svcsubproc.para: To adjust the hood on the IC BUS and achieve the proper spacing between the hood and cowl, use the following procedures.

note.para: The hood-to-cowl adjustment dimension is 1/2 inch (12.7 mm) minimum.

step1.para: Make 2 wood spacer blocks that are sized 1/2 x 1.0 x 24.0 inches (12.7 x 25.4 x 609.6 mm).

With the hood closed and latched, try to place the 2 hood-to-cowl spacer blocks on top of the cowl flange between the hood and cowl. If the hood needs adjustment to allow the spacer blocks to fit between the hood and cowl or to make the hood rest against the front of the spacer blocks, refer to Forward or Back at the Lower Hinge Plate, or IC BUS Hood Adjustment Up or Down at the Lower Hinge Plate Bracket.

3. CARRIAGE BOLT, FLAT WASHER, LOCKWASHER AND HEX NUT (3/8-16 UNC)

step1.para: To adjust the right and left side hood hinges (Item 1) side-to-side (Item 2) to provide the proper clearance at the radiator and cab cowl sides, use the following procedure.
Release the hood latches on each side of the hood and tilt the hood assembly to full open position.
Loosen (to finger tight), but do not remove, the 3 upper hinge plate carriage bolts and hex nuts (Item 3) at both upper hinge plates (Item 4), passenger side shown.

Push the hood side-to-side (Item 2), as required, to get the proper hood clearance at the radiator and cab cowl sides, then tighten the 3 upper hinge plate carriage bolts and hex nuts (Item 3) at each upper hinge plate (Item 4), passenger side shown. Tighten to 34 to 38 ft-lbs. (46 to 51 Nm).
Close and latch the hood on both sides and check the hood clearance at the radiator and cab cowl sides. If further adjustment is required, repeat this procedure.
